alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 18 at 8:59PM PST until December 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY FOR WESTERN KITTITAS COUNTY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory for Western Kittitas County, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Portions of I-90 over Snoqualmie Pass will be impacted by snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
